content:
This is a hard one. It seems crazy to me with how AI is being sold to people. I very much thought that it would hollow out many companies before being sold as a product. I'm concerned at the speed of change here.. but also I do feel like there's a lot lacking on current AI products. It will try to make the user happy so biases will be re-enforced instead of challenges. Both AI themselves and the people using it can fall into a psychosis filled with imagined truths about the world. I feel like this is dangerous, especially when you consider the fact that LLMs do NOT "think". Yes, even when you tell it to think, it is only guessing at appropriate output for the given context and input. This process, I believe, is very different from general AI.

I think we already tainted the internet... But to be fair, AI written news articles have been a thing for much longer than the current LLM hype cycle. I'm now wondering if it's possible to undo the damage to humanity's knowledge base.

But yes, I think everyone is responsible for what will come from AI. Particularly those who are trying to cash in on the bubble.
